## **For Contributors**

### **Type of Change**

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change that fixes an issue)
- [ ] Feature (non-breaking change that adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (a change that alters existing functionality)
- [ ] Chore (maintenance or cleanup tasks)
- [ ] Documentation (adds or updates documentation)

### **Checklist**

- [ ] I have followed the [Contributing Guidelines](./CONTRIBUTING.md) for this project.
- [ ] My code adheres to the project's coding standards and conventions.
- [ ] I have tested my changes, and they work as expected.
- [ ] I have added tests to cover my changes (if applicable).
- [ ] I have updated the documentation (if applicable).
- [ ] My commit messages follow the [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) guidelines.

### **Screenshots (if applicable)**

Please include any relevant screenshots if your change affects the UI and ensure to describe what the screenshot shows.

### **How Has This Been Tested?**

Describe the testing performed. Include details such as the environment, test cases, and steps to reproduce.

---

## **For Maintainers**

### **Review Checklist**

- [ ] PR is linked to the appropriate issue.
- [ ] Code changes align with the project's goals and standards.
- [ ] New or updated functionality has been sufficiently tested.
- [ ] Documentation has been updated to reflect changes.
- [ ] The commit messages follow the [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/) guidelines.
- [ ] Changes have been tested in staging or pre-production environments (if applicable).

### **Branching & Merging**

- [ ] The PR targets the correct branch (`dev` for development, `main` for production).
- [ ] All conflicts have been resolved.
- [ ] The feature or fix has been thoroughly tested and is ready for merge or further review.

---

## **Related Issues**

List any related issues, pull requests, or discussions. Use 'Fixes' or 'Closes' with the relevant issue number.
